page.title: 20LITTLEPORT VILLAGE COLLEGE
page.content: 1986 sees the{closure}of the village 11-16 school and the transfer of all its pupils to the new college at Ely. They will travel the 5 miles daily by bus. The present buildings will be used by the primary school. Reducing numbers have seen the school reduced to less than three form entry. Sixth form students already travel to Ely. The school was originally called the {Martin School}after a local family. It was opened in 1956 and became a community school and comprehensive in 1972. Pupils and teachers of the 1985 first year contributed to the{BBC Domesday Project in their Humanities lessons, interviewing local people, counting amenities, travelling by minibus to complete the land-use survey and typing in the information on the school's computers.
